text.section: A trustee shall give bond to secure performance of the trusteeâ€™s duties only if the court finds that a bond is needed to protect the interests of the beneficiaries or is required by the terms of the trust and the court has not dispensed with the requirement.
The court may specify the amount of a bond, its liabilities, and whether sureties are necessary. The court may modify or terminate a bond at any time.
A regulated financial institution qualified to do trust business in this Commonwealth need not give bond, even if required by the terms of the trust.

law.history: Created 2014 Ky. Acts ch. 25, sec. 51, effective July 15, 2014.
